[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Field: distribute_rewards_events] Can distribute_rewards_events be emitted without actual reward distribution occurring, causing off-chain indexers to show inflated validator performance and attracting delegator stake based on false data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Field: add_stake_events] Can add_stake_events be emitted with amount_added exceeding u64::MAX through manipulation, causing event stream consumers to record incorrect stake totals that diverge from actual on-chain state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Field: withdraw_stake_events] If withdraw_stake_events are emitted but the actual withdrawal fails (e.g., due to timelock), can this cause indexers to show incorrect balances, enabling social engineering attacks on delegators? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Field: rotate_consensus_key_events] Can rotate_consensus_key_events be replayed or forged to emit the same old/new key pair multiple times, causing confusion in validator monitoring systems about which key is currently active? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Field: set_operator_events] Can set_operator_events be manipulated to show operator changes that didn't actually occur, enabling phishing attacks where users trust an attacker-displayed operator address? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Deserialization] Can malicious BCS (Binary Canonical Serialization) data be crafted to deserialize a StakePool with inconsistent field values (e.g., pending_inactive > total stake) that bypass Move module validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Deserialization] Does the Deserialize trait implementation validate that EventHandle fields are properly initialized, or can deserialization produce a StakePool with null/invalid event handles that crash the validator when events are emitted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Serialization] Can extremely large values in EventHandle counters cause serialization to fail or produce oversized byte arrays that trigger denial-of-service in network transmission or storage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: StakePool] [Deserialization] If AccountAddress fields (operator_address, delegated_voter) are deserialized from malformed input, can this produce invalid addresses (e.g., addresses with special meaning in Move) that bypass access control checks? [File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: RegisterValidatorCandidateEvent] [Field: pool_address] Can pool_address in RegisterValidatorCandidateEvent be set to an address that doesn't actually contain a stake pool, causing indexers to track non-existent validators and corrupt off-chain validator registries? [File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: SetOperatorEvent] [Fields: old_operator, new_operator] Can old_operator and new_operator be set to the same address in SetOperatorEvent, indicating a no-op operation that should be rejected but might be accepted, enabling event spam? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: AddStakeEvent] [Field: amount_added] Can amount_added in AddStakeEvent be set to zero or u64::MAX, either indicating spurious events or potential overflow attacks when aggregating stake additions across multiple events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: AddStakeEvent] [Field: amount_added] If amount_added is set to a very large value (e.g., u64::MAX - 1) that causes overflow when added to existing stake, will the event still be emitted, creating a mismatch between events and actual state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/stake_pool.rs] [Struct: ReactivateStakeEvent] [Field: amount] Can the amount field in ReactivateStakeEvent exceed the inactive stake available in the pool, indicating that the event was emitted for an invalid operation that should have been rejected? (Medium)
